Error.Description: Too many requests sent for given period.
The syntax of the request entity is correct, but server was unable to process the contained instructions.
Error.Details: server is unable to process the instructions.

Location.description: The URL to check on status of resource

RiskDimensions.description:
This parameter filters results by array of RiskDimensions. Defaults to cyber. privacy is a new option for customers with privacy licenses.
?risk_dimensions[]=privacy&risk_dimensions[]=cyber
RiskDimensions.name: risk_dimensions[]

PublicEventDateStart.description: Filter results after the provided date string in format YYYY-MM-DD.
PublicEventDateStart.name: public_event_start_date

SecurityCriteria.description: Filter results by the Security Criteria.
SecurityCriteria.name: security_criteria

RiskPolicy.description: Filter findings based on customer risk policy.  This can be setup at https://portal.riskrecon.com/portal/risk-policy.
RiskPolicy.name: risk_policy

NumericAssetValues.description: Filter results by asset_value_numeric. An example of a query string with multiple asset_value_numeric values would look like ?asset_value_numeric[]=1&asset_value_numeric[]=3
NumericAssetValues.name: asset_value_numeric[]

AssetValue.description: This parameter filters finding results by asset_value.
AssetValue.name: asset_value

StartDate.description: Filter results after the provided date string in format YYYY-MM-DD. Can't search back further than 1 month.
StartDate.name: start_date

BreachEventDateStart.description: Filter results after the provided date string in format YYYY-MM-DD.
BreachEventDateStart.name: breach_event_start_date

Domain.description: Search TOEs by domain or hostname. This must be a valid domain or hostname.
Domain.name: domain

LastRetrieved.description: Filter results published or updated after the provided date string in format YYYY-MM-DD.  An example request would like like ?last_retrieved=2020-11-20 and this would grab results updated on or after 2020-11-20.
LastRetrieved.name: last_retrieved

Severities.description: Filter results by severity. An example of a query string with multiple severities would look like ?severity[]=low&severity[]=medium&severity[]=high.
Severities.name: severity[]

BreachEventsSortAttribute.description: This parameter is optional but allows the user to sort results of breach events by available sort attributes.
BreachEventsSortAttribute.name: sort_attribute

PortfolioRatingReportSortAttribute.description: This parameter is optional but allows the user to sort results of portfolio ratings by available sort attributes.
PortfolioRatingReportSortAttribute.name: sort_attribute

RiskRelationshipSlugs.description: filter results based on customer risk_relationship_slugs, which are returned from /v1/portfolio/risk_relationships_folders. This is optional.
RiskRelationshipSlugs.name: risk_relationship_slugs[]

RiskStandardId.description: Filter by the risk standard id.
RiskStandardId.name: risk_standard_id

Page.description: This parameter is the page number in routes that have pagination.
Page.name: page

InternalId.description: This parameter filters results by internal_id. A TOE can actually have multiple internal_ids so it will filter if the given internal_id is one of them (if there are multiple).
InternalId.name: internal_id[]

PerPage250.description: This parameter sets the results limit per page.  This defaults to 20 and currently has a max of 250.
PerPage250.name: per_page

IncludeTrend.description: This parameter gives the option to include trending data for current analysis request.  Normally, this is only included when looking at the historical analyses.
IncludeTrend.name: include_trend

AssetValues.description:
This parameter filters finding results by asset_values. An example of a query string with multiple asset_values would look like:

?asset_value[]=high&asset_value[]=low
AssetValues.name: asset_value[]

EndDate.description: This parameter filters results before the provided date string in format YYYY-MM-DD. Defaults to current date.  Must be after start_date.
EndDate.name: end_date

AlertingIssuesSortAttribute.description: This parameter is optional but allows the user to sort results of alerting issues by available sort attributes.
AlertingIssuesSortAttribute.name: sort_attribute

AlertTypes.description: type of score change alert This parameter is optional but allows the user to filter results by available alert_types.
AlertTypes.name: alert_types[]

DaysAgo.description: This parameter filters results by the number of days ago.  This is optional but allows the user to filter results by the number of days ago.
DaysAgo.name: days_ago

CveId.description:
This parameter filters finding results by single Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE). For example:

?cve_id=CVE-1999-0001
CveId.name: cve_id

CurrentRatingOnly.description: Option to return only the current most recent rating. Pretty much another way to set per_page to 1.
CurrentRatingOnly.name: current_rating_only

SortMethod.description: Sort results by ascending or descending order.
SortMethod.name: sort_method

PerPage.description: This parameter sets the results limit per page.  This defaults to 20 and currently has a max of 50.
PerPage.name: per_page

RiskDimension.description: This parameter filters results by RiskDimension. The default value is cyber. privacy is a new option for customers with privacy licenses.
RiskDimension.name: risk_dimension

FindingsSortAttribute.description: This parameter is optional but allows the user to sort results of alerting issues by available sort attributes.
FindingsSortAttribute.name: sort_attribute

CveIds.description:
This parameter filters finding results by array of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE). An example of a query string with multiple cves would look like:

?cve_ids[]=CVE-1999-0001&cve_ids[]=CVE-1999-0002
CveIds.name: cve_ids[]

CreatedAtStart.description: Filter results after the provided date string in format YYYY-MM-DD.
CreatedAtStart.name: created_at_start_date

AlertingScoreChangesSortAttribute.description: This parameter is optional but allows the user to sort results of alerting issues by available sort attributes.
AlertingScoreChangesSortAttribute.name: sort_attribute

Priority.description: Filter results by priority. An example of a query string with multiple priority values would look like ?priority[]=1&priority[]=3.
Priority.name: priority[]

Priorities.description: Filter findings based on  priority. Priority is based on asset_value and severity.
Priorities.name: priorities[]

RequestId.description: This parameter is the report request ID.
RequestId.name: request_id

SecurityDomain.description: Filter results by the Security Domain.
SecurityDomain.name: security_domain

UnauthorizedErrorResponse.description: Authentication information was missing or invalid or the user is not authorized to access resource or perform the associated action.

BadRequestErrorResponse.description: Something was wrong with the request

UnprocessableEntityResponse.description: The syntax of the request entity is correct, but server was unable to process the contained instructions.

TooManyRequestsResponse.description: User has sent too many requests in a given amount of time

info.description:
RiskRecon provides organizations with frequent, comprehensive, actionable visibility into the security quality of their business partners.  RiskRecon does this by automatically measuring the security performance of any enterprise across security domains and criteria, providing visibility into security programs.

All of the security discovery and analytics are based on public information with no inside access required.  The RiskRecon service requires an account with RiskRecon.
info.title: Riskrecon API

get.description: This resource returns Alerting Issues from new scans in their portfolio based on the users alert settings.  Alert settings can be changed at https://portal.riskrecon.com/portal/alert-center/alert-settings.
get.summary: This resource returns Alerting Issues from new scans in their portfolio based on the users alert settings.

get.description: This resource returns any rating/score changes from new scans in the users portfolio based on the users alert settings. Alert settings can be changed at https://portal.riskrecon.com/portal/alert-center/alert-settings.
get.summary: This resource returns any rating/score changes from new scans in the users portfolio based on the users alert settings.

get.description: RiskRecon automatically reports each vendors progress in addressing their action plan issues. This API returns issue progress for a given action plan.
get.summary: This resource tracks and reports a vendors progress in addressing action plan issues.

get.description:
This API returns the counts of action plans as per their severity and priority. Found issues are assigned a Priority and Severity index. The end-user needs to input the TOE ID (toe_id) for a given action plan in the API request.

In this scenario, the following are returned in the response:
* the asset value starting from 1 to 4, where 1 = Idle, 2 = Low, 3 = Medium, 4 = High
* total count of issues for each asset value
* total count of issues by severity. The severity values can be Low, Medium, High, and Critical.
get.summary: This API returns the count of current action plan issues per their severity and priority.

get.description: :: Legacy Route Please use getToeRatings :: This resource returns the most recent `Analysis` object by the TOE identifier. This includes the security domain and criteria ratings. Trend data is only included if `include_trend` query param is added.
get.summary: :: Legacy Route Please use getToeRatings :: This resource returns the most recent `Analysis` object by the TOE identifier. Trend data is only included if `include_trend` query param is added.

get.description:
This endpoint allows the user to search for Company name, TOE ID by a valid CVE.
The user must provide a valid cve in query param.
get.summary: This endpoint allows the user to search for Company name, TOE ID by a valid CVE.

get.description:
This API retrieves a collection of TOE objects mapped to a customer.
This include overall ratings and some domain rating information for the current analysis of the provided TOE id.
As a TOE can have multiple internal IDs, this API filters if the internal ID is one among the multiple internal IDs.
get.summary: This resource returns a collection of `TOE` objects mapped to a customer.

get.description:
This use case describes how the Findings API is used to retrieve a list of findings for the latest analysis for a TOE. The toe_id is passed in the API request. In this scenario, all findings for that TOE are returned in the response.
To limit or filter the data returned in the response, you can use various parameters in the API request:
* Filter by an asset value: You can use the asset_value parameter to search for findings with high, medium, or low asset value.
* Filter by severity: You can use the severity parameter to search for findings with high, medium, or low severity.
* Filter by asset value and severity: You can use asset_value and severity parameters to search for findings with high, medium, or low asset value and severity.
* Filter by page: You can use the page parameter to search for findings pages.
* Sort by Findings Attribute: You can use the sort attribute to sort results of alerting issues by available sort attributes.
get.summary: This resource returns a list of findings for latest analysis for a given TOE.

get.description: This resource returns a list of Hosts for latest analysis for a given TOE. This includes domain and netblock information as well.
get.summary: This resource returns a list of Hosts for latest analysis for a given TOE.

get.description:
The User route is used to get all the user data for ones organization.
There currently are no filters or params.
get.summary: The User route is used to get all the user data for ones organization.

get.description: Get the current or historical overall, domain and criteria ratings for a given TOE and a given risk dimension. Privacy can only be returned if privacy is enabled for your customer and you have a privacy license for the given TOE.
get.summary: Get the current or historical overall, domain and criteria ratings for a given TOE and a given risk dimension.

get.description: This API returns a list of findings for a given action plan of a TOE. The end-user needs to input the TOE ID (toe_id) for a given action plan in the API request.
get.summary: This resource returns a list of finding details from an action plan of a TOE.

get.description:
The Integration Routes API provides a list of URLs for the security domains within the Security Profile section of the RiskRecon Portal.
If one of the URLs is followed by an unauthenticated user, they will be prompted to authenticate before they are redirected to the requested URL.
The only parameter for this API is the TOE ID, which is required.
get.summary: The Integration Routes API provides a list of URLs for the security domains within the Security Profile section of the RiskRecon Portal.

get.description: :: Legacy Route Please use getTOERatings :: This resource returns a collection of historical `Analysis` objects by the TOE identifier. This includes the security domain and criteria ratings for each analysis.
get.summary: :: Legacy Route Please use getToeRatings :: This resource returns a collection of historical `Analysis` objects by the TOE identifier.

delete.description: User can delete a TOE from their portfolio by providing the toe_id in endpoint.
delete.summary: This endpoint deletes an existing TOE to the users portfolio.

get.description:
This resource gets a `TOE` object by its identifier.
This include overall ratings and some domain rating information for the current analysis of the provided TOE id.
get.summary: This resource gets a `TOE` object by its identifier.

post.description:
This endpoint adds an existing TOE to the users portfolio.
The toe_id and other information can be obtained from the /v1/toes/by_domains response.
post.summary: This endpoint adds an existing TOE to the users portfolio.

put.description:
This endpoint allows a user to update the internal_ids and/or internal_name of an existing `TOE` by its identifier.
These can be used to map a TOE in the RiskRecon system to an entity in the users system.
put.summary: This endpoint allows a user to update the internal_ids and/or internal_name of an existing `TOE` by its identifier.

get.description: This resource gets the PDF report.
get.summary: This resource returns the PDF report.

get.description: This resource returns risk standard controls associated with a TOE id and a particular custom or industry standard.  The risk standard id can be obtained from the /v1/compliance/{toe_id} response. Some will be mapped to RiskRecon security domain and criteria so will include the ratings for these domain/criteria and the TOE being queried.
get.summary: This resource returns risk standard controls associated with a TOE id and a particular custom or industry standard.

get.description:
This route returns a collection of `Subsidiary` objects associated with a toe.
Any TOEs that appear to be a subsidiary of the provided TOE id are returned in the response.
get.summary: This route returns a collection of `Subsidiary` objects associated with a toe.

get.description:
This endpoint allows the user to search for a TOE by a valid domain or hostname.
The user must provide a valid domain or hostname in domain query param.
get.summary: This endpoint allows the user to search for a TOE by a valid domain or hostname.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of portfolio ratings with their changes over time
get.summary: Get portfolio ratings report

get.description:
::Legacy Route please use findings_paginated:: This use case describes how the Findings API is used to retrieve a list of findings for the latest analysis for a TOE. The toe_id is passed in the API request. In this scenario, all findings for that TOE are returned in the response.
To limit or filter the data returned in the response, you can use various parameters in the API request:
* Filter by an asset value: You can use the asset_value parameter to search for findings with high, medium, or low asset value.
* Filter by severity: You can use the severity parameter to search for findings with high, medium, or low severity.
* Filter by asset value and severity: You can use asset_value and severity parameters to search for findings with high, medium, or low asset value and severity.
* Filter by multiple asset values: You can use the asset_value parameter multiple times to search for findings with multiple asset values.
get.summary: :: Legacy Route :: This resource returns a list of findings for latest analysis for a given TOE.

put.description: User can move a TOE from one risk relationship folder to another by providing the toe_id and relationship folder slug in request. Relationship folder slug can be retrieved from [/v1/portfolio/risk_relationships_folders](#/Portfolio/getRiskRelationshipsFolders).
put.summary: This endpoint moves an existing TOE from one risk relationship folder to another

post.description:
This is a bulk request for requesting to add new TOEs (targets of evaluation) to your portfolio.
The request must have at least one item but no more than 25 per request.
post.summary: This endpoint is for requesting to add new TOEs (targets of evaluation) to your portfolio.

get.description:
This API returns the vendor status summary counts of a given action plan. The end-user needs to input the TOE ID (toe_id) for a given action plan in the API request.

In this scenario, the following are returned in the response:

* total action plans provided to the vendor
* the label of the action plans
* the status of the action plans
get.summary: This API returns the vendor status summary counts of a given action plan.

get.description: This resource returns an list of custom and industry standards. Each standard has a number of controls.  Some of these will be mapped to RiskRecon security domain and criteria and will have the associated ratings.
get.summary: This resource returns an list of custom and industry standards.

get.description: This resource returns a mapping of security_criteria labels and their current display names in the RiskRecon portal.  It also includes if the security_criteria is currently rated and if it is deprecated.
get.summary: This resource returns a mapping of security_criteria labels and their current display names in the RiskRecon portal.

get.description:
This resource gets the customer's risk relationship folders names and slugs.
The slug will be used in requests that require the risk relationship. Risk relationships can be updated here https://portal.riskrecon.com/portal/risk-configuration if you have necessary permissions.
get.summary: This resource gets the customer's risk relationship folders names and slugs.

get.description: This resource returns a mapping of security_domain labels and their current display names in the RiskRecon portal.  It also includes if the security_domain is currently rated and if it is deprecated.
get.summary: This resource returns a mapping of security_domain labels and their current display names in the RiskRecon portal.

get.description: This resource returns a collection of `DataLossEvent` objects for a portfolio. This is for the entire portfolio and has pagination unlike the data_loss_events route.
get.summary: This resource returns a collection of `BreachEvent` objects.

get.description: This API returns a list of issue summaries for a given action plan. There are no parameters for this use case. The end-user needs to input the TOE ID (toe_id) for a given action plan in the API request.
get.summary: This resource returns a vendor's action plan issue summary.

get.description: This API returns action plan configurations both automated and manual for a given TOE. The end-user needs to input the TOE ID (toe_id) for a given action plan in the API request.
get.summary: This resource returns action plan configurations both automated and manual for a given TOE.

post.description:
This API sends action plan findings to internal and external recipients. The end-user needs to input the TOE ID (toe_id) for a given action plan in the API request.

Recipients and frequency are optional. If recipients are not provided, the action plan will be shared with previously shared recipients. If frequency is not provided, the action plan will be shared manually.

Users can retrive action plan configuration from ```(GET) /v1/action_plan/{toe_id} ``` API.
* recipients: An Array of first_name, last_name, email, internal (true/false) for each recipient. See schema for more details.
* frequency:  0 (default) is for manaul/one-off, where 30/60/90 sets periodic automated action plan emails.
post.summary: This resource sends action plan email to recipients of a TOE.

get.description:
This resource returns the default subscription_level for bulk toe requests for your customer if it has been set.

This can be set if you want all /v1/portfolio/bulk_add requests to have the same subscription level.

Options are 1 (Discover) or 2 (Advisor)
get.summary: This resource returns the default subscription_level for bulk toe requests for your customer.

put.description:
This resource sets the default subscription_level for bulk toe requests for your customer if it has been set.

This can be set if you want all /v1/portfolio/bulk_add requests to have the same subscription level.

Options are 1 (Discover) or 2 (Advisor)
put.summary: This resource sets the default subscription_level for bulk toe requests for your customer.

get.description: "::Legacy Route please use portfolio_data_loss_events:: This resource returns a collection of `DataLossEvent` objects for a given TOE id. This are referred to as Breach Events in the RiskRecon site."
get.summary: :: Legacy Route :: This resource returns a collection of `DataLossEvent` objects.

get.description: This resource returns all report requests submitted in the last 24 hours by the client.
get.summary: This resource returns the list of active report request.

post.description:
This endpoint provides the ordering of the following toe reports:
  - Executive Report - The Executive Report (executive-report) provides an executive summary  of the RiskRecon ratings and security performance metrics.
  - Summary Report - The RiskRecon Summary Report (summary-report) provides the summary  RiskRecon ratings and security performance metrics.
  - Detailed Report - The RiskRecon Detailed Report (detailed-report) provides the RiskRecon  ratings, security performance metrics, and detailed findings and recommendations.
  - Action Plan - The action plan (action-plan) on this toe.
post.summary: This resource allows the ordering and downloading of toe reports

tags.description: Operations related to Data Loss Events
tags.name: Data Loss Events

tags.description: Operations related to the users Portfolio
tags.name: Portfolio

tags.description: Operations related to a TOEs subsidiaries
tags.name: Subsidiaries

tags.description: Operations related to TOEs (Target of Evaluation)
tags.name: Target Of Evaluation TOE
